cardiac_emergency.title: Heart Attack / Cardiac Emergency
steps: Chew aspirin if available and not allergic
If unconscious and not breathing, begin CPR: 100-120 compressions/min on chest center
warnings: Do NOT give aspirin if allergic
Do NOT let person walk
Do NOT ignore mild chest pain
cardiac_emergency.whenToCallDoctor: Always call 108 for any chest pain.

unconsciousness.title: Unconscious Person
steps: Clear airway â€” tilt head, lift chin
Do NOT give food or water
warnings: Do NOT shake violently
Do NOT pour water on face
Do NOT leave alone

severe_bleeding.title: Severe Bleeding
steps: Apply firm direct pressure with clean cloth
Do NOT remove cloth â€” add more layers
Apply tourniquet only as last resort
warnings: Do NOT remove embedded objects
Watch for shock signs: pale, cold, rapid pulse
severe_bleeding.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for bleeding that won't stop within 15 minutes.

stroke.title: Stroke (FAST)
steps: FAST: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech slurred, Time to call
Lay down with head slightly elevated
Do NOT give food, water, or medicine
warnings: Do NOT give aspirin for stroke
Every minute counts
Do NOT let them drive
stroke.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 immediately. Treatment within 3 hours is critical.

choking.title: Choking
steps: If can cough, encourage forceful coughing
If unable to cough/breathe: Heimlich manoeuvre
Stand behind, fist above navel, thrust inward and upward
For infants: 5 back blows then 5 chest thrusts
If unconscious, call 108 and begin CPR
warnings: Do NOT do blind finger sweeps
For pregnant women: chest thrusts instead
choking.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 if object doesn't come out or person becomes unconscious.

snake_bite.title: Snake Bite
steps: Keep bitten limb below heart level
warnings: Do NOT cut wound
Do NOT suck venom
Do NOT apply ice or tourniquet
snake_bite.whenToCallDoctor: Always get to hospital for ANY snake bite.

burns.title: Burns
steps: Cover loosely with clean non-stick dressing
warnings: Do NOT apply ice, butter, or toothpaste
Do NOT burst blisters
burns.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for burns larger than palm, on face/hands/feet, or deep burns.

poisoning.title: Poisoning
warnings: Do NOT induce vomiting unless directed
Do NOT give anything by mouth if unconscious

head_injury.title: Head Injury
steps: Apply ice pack wrapped in cloth
warnings: Do NOT give aspirin
Do NOT let person sleep for 2-3 hours
head_injury.whenToCallDoctor: Seek help for loss of consciousness, vomiting, or confusion.

seizure.title: Seizure / Convulsion
steps: Do NOT put anything in mouth
warnings: Do NOT hold them down
Do NOT give food/water until conscious
seizure.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 if seizure lasts > 5 min or first-time seizure.

allergic_reaction.title: Anaphylaxis
warnings: Reaction can return
Even if EpiPen helps, go to hospital

asthma.title: Asthma Attack
steps: Wait 4 min, 4 more puffs if needed
warnings: Do NOT force to lie down
Do NOT give sedatives
asthma.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 if inhaler gives no relief or lips turn blue.

spinal_injury.title: Spinal Injury
warnings: Do NOT bend/twist neck
Do NOT let person get up
Do NOT remove helmet
spinal_injury.whenToCallDoctor: Always call 108 for suspected spinal injury.

drowning.title: Drowning
steps: If not breathing: 5 rescue breaths then CPR
warnings: Do NOT try to drain water from lungs
Always get medical check-up
drowning.whenToCallDoctor: Always call 108. All drowning cases need hospital evaluation.

heat_stroke.title: Heat Stroke
steps: Ice packs to neck, armpits, groin
Sips of cool water if conscious
warnings: Do NOT give fever medicine
Do NOT give large amounts of water
heat_stroke.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for temp > 40Â°C, confusion, or unconsciousness.

hypothermia.title: Hypothermia
steps: Apply warm water bottles to chest/neck/groin
warnings: Do NOT apply direct heat
Do NOT rub skin
Handle gently
hypothermia.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for severe hypothermia or unconsciousness.

electric_shock.title: Electrical Injury
steps: Do NOT touch if near power source
warnings: Do NOT use wet materials
Internal injuries may not be visible

diabetic_emergency.title: Diabetic Emergency
steps: If conscious + low sugar: give juice/candy/sugar water
Do NOT give food if unconscious
warnings: If unsure high/low, give sugar â€” safer
Do NOT inject insulin unless trained
diabetic_emergency.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 if unconscious, seizures, or no improvement.

pregnancy_emergency.title: Pregnancy Emergency
warnings: Do NOT delay calling help
Do NOT insert anything
Do NOT give medicines
pregnancy_emergency.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for bleeding, early water breaking, or severe pain.

vomiting_blood.title: Vomiting Blood
steps: Keep on side to prevent choking
warnings: Bright red = active bleed, dark = older bleed â€” both serious
vomiting_blood.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for ANY vomiting of blood.

meningitis.title: Meningitis Suspicion
steps: Glass test: press glass on rash â€” if rash stays, urgent
warnings: Can progress rapidly
High fever + stiff neck = suspect meningitis

bites_stings.title: Insect & Animal Bites
steps: For dog bites: wash 15 min with soap
warnings: Watch for anaphylaxis
All dog/bat bites need rabies evaluation
bites_stings.whenToCallDoctor: Seek help for large swelling, breathing difficulty, or animal bites.

fracture.title: Broken Bone / Fracture
steps: If bone protruding, cover â€” do NOT push back
warnings: Do NOT straighten deformed limb
Watch for shock in severe fractures
fracture.whenToCallDoctor: Go to hospital for all suspected fractures.

eye_injury.title: Eye Injury
steps: Embedded objects: cover both eyes loosely
warnings: Do NOT try to remove embedded objects
Do NOT apply pressure
eye_injury.whenToCallDoctor: Seek immediate help for any significant eye injury.

abdominal_pain.title: Abdominal Pain
steps: Do NOT eat until cause known
warnings: Severe + fever + vomiting may be surgical emergency
Right lower side may be appendicitis
abdominal_pain.whenToCallDoctor: Call 108 for severe pain with fever, vomiting, or blood.

dehydration.title: Dehydration
steps: Prepare ORS: 1L water + 6 tsp sugar + Â½ tsp salt
warnings: Severe dehydration can be fatal in children
If unable to drink, need IV fluids
dehydration.whenToCallDoctor: Seek help if unable to keep fluids down or no urine for 8 hours.

breathing_difficulty.title: Breathing Difficulty
steps: Slow deep breathing: nose in, mouth out
Call 108 if no improvement in 5 min
warnings: Blue lips = severe oxygen deprivation â€” critical
Do NOT give sedatives

general_care.title: General Home Care
warnings: Do NOT ignore persistent symptoms
See doctor if fever > 3 days
general_care.whenToCallDoctor: See doctor if symptoms last > 48 hours or worsen.
